title: Mum's tragic photos of son taken months apart reveal horrific toll of drug abuse
text:

A mum has shared raw before-and-after pictures of her missing son to show the public the tragic effects of drug addiction.

The Las Vegas mum shared the photos of her 26-year-old son Cody Bishop in a now-viral Facebook post, describing him as the "face of heroin and meth."

Jennifer Salfen-Tracy revealed she had not seen her son in weeks - writing she believes he is deep in a spiral of addiction and probably living on the streets somewhere in the US state of Nevada.

The pictures show Cody transformed from a beaming, healthy, fresh-faced looking young man, to an emaciated shadow of his former self, frowning and covered in sores.

(Image: Facebook)

The heartbroken mum revealed pictures were actually only taken months apart, as she urged her son to find her and get in touch.

“These pictures were taken seven months apart. That is how fast someone is affected,” his mum said.

“Cody is still homeless in Las Vegas and I have not heard from him in weeks now. Hearing how bad he is doing is hard but not hearing at all is worse.

She explained: "I am hesitant on sharing but many people ask how things are going so I feel I should share. I have learned along this path that so many people and families deal with the same heartache but just do not talk about it.

"This is a true issue in our world today that we need to pull together and focus on to fix instead of the government worrying about and spending all their money on throwing each other under the bus."

The Facebook post in which the mum urged "let's get a hold of this issue America" has been shared nearly 40,000 times since it was posted two days ago.

A missing persons page said he had previously been reported missing to Las Vegas Police in May after his family reported concerns for his wellbeing.

It said his family had been unable to trace him after he did a stint in rehab in Nevada.

The post said he had been living homeless before, and was often with a girl called Kate, and urged anyone who came across him to contact the authorities.

If you or someone you know is struggling with drug addiction, please visit drugwise.org.uk or addaction.org.uk for advice and support, or contact helpline DrugFAM on 0300 888 3853 9am-5pm Mon - Fri, or visit drugfam.co.uk .
description: The Las Vegas mum posted the photos online to show the toll drug addiction can have on a young life
